title: Collect Water from Tropical Vines
brief: Extract safe drinking water from water-bearing vines using proper technique.
steps: Step 1: Look for vines with rough bark and shoots about 5 centimeters thick.
Step 2: Cut the vine and observe the sap - clear fluid is safe, sticky milky sap is poisonous.
Step 3: Cut a section of vine and hold it above your mouth.
Step 4: Let the liquid drip into your mouth rather than putting mouth directly on vine.
Step 5: Use a container to collect liquid if available.
Step 6: Test small amounts first to check for skin irritation.
warnings: Some vines have poisonous sap that appears as sticky, milky substance.
Some vines cause skin irritation on contact.
Not all thick vines contain drinkable water - learn by careful testing.
